main event: A round white light was observed in the vicinity of the Big Dipper, moving from north to east over Indianapolis, Indiana on May 19, 1964.
interesting points: The object was observed at various elevations, starting at 80 degrees above the horizon and gradually descending to 3 degrees above the horizon as it moved eastward.
The sighting coincided with the passage of the ECHO I satellite.
Similar sightings were reported in other locations, including Huntington, West Virginia and Jefferson City, Missouri, with the object moving in a generally southeasterly direction.
The object was described as gradually disappearing from view.
The report indicates that the sighting was observed by military personnel, including Lt. Carroll L. Henderson of the USAF 8th Air Force Command Post.
witnesses: military personnel, including Lt. Carroll L. Henderson
